page.title: 13Changing Times
page.content: My family became tenants of the{smithy in 1919. In 1920 we started selling {petrol}from cans; installed petrol pumps in 1924; we started{repairing {cars,}recharging wireless batteries, welding, maintaining milking machine engines, and general engineering in the following years. We had a{horse {and waggonette,}and later{motorcars {(taxis) for hire.}When the farmers got {tractors}we converted horse drawn equipment for towing by tractors, and when{electricity}became available, we converted{milking machine}engines to do other tasks, such as driving elevators. For thirty years we conveyed{children}to vairous{schools from many areas. In 1971 we sold our business and the smithy became a{cafe, the shoeing house became the kitchen, the cowshed became toilets, and the orchard a{car park.
